1.text: My son, if thou becamest surety for thy friend, thou didst strike thy hands for a stranger;

2.text: Thou wert snared with the sayings of thy mouth, thou wert taken with the sayings of thy mouth.

3.text: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself when thou camest into the hand of thy friend; go humble thyself and enlarge thy friend.

4.text: Thou shalt not give sleep to thine eyes, and slumber to thine eyelashes.

5.text: Deliver thyself as the roe from the hand, and as the bird from the hand of the fowler.

6.text: Go to the ant, thou slothful one; see her ways, and be wise:

7.text: Which no leader to her, scribe and ruler;

8.text: She will prepare in summer her bread, gathering her food in harvest.

9.text: How long, O slothful one, wilt thou lie down? when wilt thou rise from thy sleep?

10.text: A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to lie down:

11.text: And thy poverty came as he going, and thy want as a man of the shield.

12.text: A man of Belial, a man of iniquity, goes with perverseness of mouth.

13.text: Pinching the eyes, speaking with the feet, teaching with his fingers;

14.text: Perverseness in his heart, fabricating evil in all time, he will send forth strifes.

15.text: For this, his destruction shall come suddenly; in a moment he shall be broken, and none healing.

16.text: These six Jehovah hated, and seven an abomination of his soul:

17.text: Eyes being lifted up; a tongue of falsehood, and hands shedding innocent blood,

18.text: A heart fabricating purposes of iniquity; feet being quick to run to evil,

19.text: A witness of falsehood, breathing out lies, and sending strife between brethren.

20.text: My son, watch the commands of thy father, and thou shalt not reject the laws of thy mother:

21.text: Tie them always upon thy heart; bind them upon thy throat.

22.text: In thy going about it shall lead thee; in thy lying down it shall watch over thee; and awaking, it shall speak to thee.

23.text: For the command is a lamp, and the law a light; and the way of life the reproof of instruction:

24.text: To watch thee from the woman of evil, from the smoothness of the strange tongue.

25.text: Thou shalt not desire her beauty in thy heart, and she shall not take thee with her eyelashes.

26.text: For by a woman a harlot, even to a round of bread: and a man’s wife will hunt the precious soul.

27.text: A man taking fire in his bosom, shall his garments not be burnt?

28.text: If a man shall go upon burning coals shall his feet not be burnt?

29.text: So he going in to his neighbor’s wife; all touching upon her shall not be innocent.

30.text: They will not despise a thief if he shall steal to fill up his soul; for he will be hungry.

31.text: And being found he shall recompense seven fold; he shall give all the substance of his house.

32.text: He committing adultery with a woman lacked a heart: destroying his soul he will do it.

33.text: A blow and contempt shall he find; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.

34.text: For jealousy is the wrath of man, and he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

35.text: He will not lift up the face of any ransom, and he will not be willing if thou shalt increase the reward.
